content:
Diagnosis:		Vulvar adenocarcinoma

Stage:		T1bN1M0 with right inguinal nodal involvement

Management:		12 Feb 2024 Right radical vulvectomy and bilateral inguinal node dissection
			15 Mar 2024 Commenced adjuvant chemoradiation

Current situation:	Week 4 of concurrent cisplatin-radiation therapy

[redacted name] is tolerating treatment relatively well with grade 1 radiation dermatitis affecting the vulvar and inguinal regions. She reports mild fatigue but maintains good oral intake and regular walking. Performance status remains 0. Blood results show stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters for cycle 2 cisplatin next week. Examination shows expected radiation changes but no concerning features.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 2 cisplatin on 15/4/24 and continue radiation as planned. We will review again in 2 weeks with blood tests.

cancer_timeline.value: Right radical vulvectomy and bilateral inguinal node dissection

patient_facts.value: grade 1 radiation dermatitis affecting the vulvar and inguinal regions
expected radiation changes but no concerning features
stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Vulvar adenocarcinoma with nodal involvement receiving adjuvant chemoradiation. Tolerating treatment well with minimal side effects
grade 1 radiation dermatitis affecting the vulvar and inguinal regions
continuing with planned chemoradiation, proceeding to cycle 2 cisplatin
